# The `MCExpr` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Base class for the full range of assembler expressions which are needed for parsing. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::MCExpr</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

Base class for the full range of assembler expressions which are needed for parsing.

### evaluateAsRelocatable {#aa770f9e822312cc252ee01659e0bc7d4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool MCExpr::evaluateAsRelocatable (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcvalue">MCValue</a> &amp; Res, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcassembler">MCAssembler</a> &#42; Asm, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcfixup">MCFixup</a> &#42; Fixup) const</>}>
Try to evaluate the expression to a relocatable value, i.e.

an expression of the fixed form (a - b + constant).


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Res">- The relocatable value, if evaluation succeeds.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Asm">- The assembler object to use for evaluating values.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Fixup">- The Fixup object if available.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
- True on success.
</SectionUser>

### evaluateAsValue {#a07235c25b41769181e0d69078b61d9d4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool MCExpr::evaluateAsValue (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcvalue">MCValue</a> &amp; Res, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcassembler">MCAssembler</a> &amp; Asm) const</>}>
Try to evaluate the expression to the form (a - b + constant) where neither a nor b are variables.

This is a more aggressive variant of evaluateAsRelocatable. The intended use is for when relocations are not available, like the .size directive.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcexpr-h/#l00127">127</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcexpr-h">MCExpr.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcexpr-cpp/#l00824">824</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcexpr-cpp">MCExpr.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### evaluateKnownAbsolute {#a9756a579fc66a3fbcc6d3e82866a289f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool MCExpr::evaluateKnownAbsolute (int64&#95;t &amp; Res, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcassembler">MCAssembler</a> &amp; Asm) const</>}>
Aggressive variant of evaluateAsRelocatable when relocations are unavailable (e.g.

.fill). Expects callers to handle errors when true is returned.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcexpr-h/#l00110">110</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcexpr-h">MCExpr.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcexpr-cpp/#l00596">596</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcexpr-cpp">MCExpr.cpp</a>.

### findAssociatedFragment {#ae4694d7c3e8bb89a9c2fb6227b8aa1df}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MCFragment &#42; MCExpr::findAssociatedFragment () const</>}>
Find the &quot;associated section&quot; for this expression, which is currently defined as the absolute section for constants, or otherwise the section associated with the first defined symbol in the expression.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcexpr-h/#l00133">133</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcexpr-h">MCExpr.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcexpr-cpp/#l01060">1060</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcexpr-cpp">MCExpr.cpp</a>.
